headline: To Marvel: The Cars and Food Of Italy’s Motor Valley
abstract: Francine Segan will talk about Modena and its environs at the 92nd Street Y.
lead_paragraph: Modena, and its surroundings in north-central Italy, are known as the home of balsamic vinegar and Massimo Bottura’s highly esteemed Osteria Francescana. But in some circles, the region is famous as “Motor Valley,” where high-end cars, like Ferrari, Lamborghini, Maserati, Ducati and others, are manufactured. The food historian Francine Segan will discuss dining and driving as it pertains to the area during two lectures at the 92nd Street Y, with food to sample, but nothing to test-drive.
